intro: Byrsella, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped or elliptic, with a rough texture. They produce small, yellow flowers that are clustered in heads, typical of the dandelion-like appearance. Byrsella species are often found in grassy areas and are adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
